_header: The cat the rat and Lovell our dog
Note:
Cf. Mirror for Magistrates (Campbell (1939)
XCampbell, L. B. The Mirror for Magistrates. Cambridge, 1939; STC 13445, p. cxxxviii a. Tilley (1950)
XTilley, Morris Palmer. A Dictionary of the Proverbs in England in the 16th and 17th Centuries. Ann Arbor, MI: University of Michigan, 1950, C 143.
Subjects: historical verse; Richard III; chronicles, verse in; inscriptions
_description: Wyllyam Colyngbourne, Verses on England in 1485, against the advisors of Richard III, posted on the doors of St Paul’s Cathedral — one couplet

HarEng766.Transcription:
The Catt the Ratt and lovell our DoggRulith all Englond vnder an
                    hogg
